taxonomicnotes: Puntius assimilis was originally described as Systomus assimilis by Jerdon (1849) from Madikeri, Karnataka State, southern India. Pethiyagoda and Kottelat (2005) remark that different populations of P. assimilis may turn out to be distinct species following additional studies but that they should be treated as conspecific for the present.
rationale: Puntius assimilis is assessed as Vulnerable (D2) due to its restricted distribution to four locations in the southern Western Ghats where there is an on going decline in habitat quality due to pollution. There is also an ongoing threat from the unmanaged collections for the aquarium pet trade.
